```python
MOD = 10**9 + 7

def solve():
    n = int(input())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    
    count = 0
    
    import itertools
    
    for p_tuple in itertools.permutations(range(1, n + 1)):
        p = list(p_tuple)
        ok = True
        for i in range(n):
            if p[i] != a[i] and p[p[i]-1] != a[i]:
                ok = False
                break
        if ok:
            count += 1
    
    print(count % MOD)

solve()
```
